definitions.definition: of or belonging to the person or people being spoken or written to

examples.text: Excuse me, is this your seat?
The bank is on your right.

definitions.definition: of or belonging to people in general

examples.text: Dentists advise you to have your teeth checked every six months.
In Japan you are taught great respect for your elders.

definitions.definition: used to show that somebody/something is well known or often talked about

examples.text: This is your typical English pub.

definitions.definition: used in some titles, especially those of royal people

wordOrigin: Old English ēower, genitive of gē (see the pronoun ye), of Germanic origin; related to German euer.
